problem.markdown:
1. Under otherwise uniform conditions Fanning friction factor for a rough pipe is?
( ) smaller than that for a smooth pipe ( ) equal to that for a smooth pipe (x) greater than that for a smooth pipe
2. For laminar flow in a pipe, the Fanning friction factor depends on Reynolds number according to the relation?
( ) f = 24/ Re ( ) f = 18.5/ Re (x) f = 16/ Re ( ) none
3. Applying a pressure drop across a capillary results in a volumetric flow rate Q under laminar flow conditions. The flow rate, for the same pressure drop, in a capillary of the same length but half the radius is.
( ) Q/2 ( ) Q/4 (x) Q/8 ( ) Q/16
4. For hydraulically smooth pipe, the resistance to flow depends only on the?
( ) relative roughness. ( ) absolute roughness ( ) flow Reynolds number (x) Reynolds number and relative roughness.
5. Two identical pressure gauges at the foot of two storage tanks that are at the same elevation, the water levels in the tanks are the same, one tank holds 1,00,000 litre (tank 1), the other holds 1000 litre (tank 1),. Say which one is true?
( ) Pressure gauge reading of tank 1 is greater than that of tank 2 ( ) Pressure gauge reading of tank 2 is greater than that of tank 1 (x) Pressure gauge reading of tank 1 and that of tank 2 are same
problem.p: 1. Under otherwise uniform conditions Fanning friction factor for a rough pipe is?

choicegroup.choice: smaller than that for a smooth pipe
equal to that for a smooth pipe
greater than that for a smooth pipe
